summary: a novel purification strategy for the two main type I ribosome-inactivating proteins (RIPs), -MMC and MAP30, was successfully developed for laboratory-scale preparation. two polyethylene glycol (PEG)ylated proteins were synthesized and purified. both proteins showed about 60%–70% antitumor and antivirus activities. PEGylated RIPs can be constructed with nanomaterials to be a targeting drug that can further decrease immunogenicity and side effects. they can be constructed with nanomaterials to be a targeting drug that can further decrease immunogenicity and side effects. fda has approved the PEGylated forms of therapeutic proteins. uricase, erythropoietin, granulocyte-colony stimulating factor, interferon, adenosine deaminase, asparaginase, and a growth hormone antagonist. nanotechnology uses nanomaterials to pack potential therapeutic proteins. materials and methods Materials Bitter melon seeds were obtained from the Institute of Agricultural Science and Technique of Sichuan Province, China. Matrices for electrophoresis were products of Sigma-Aldrich (St Louis, MO) and Bio-Rad Laboratories (Hercules, CA) a linear gradient of 0–0.15 M NaCl in pH 7.0, 20 mM sodium phosphate buffer eluted the column and two peaks with 30 kDa proteins were respectively collected. identification of -MMC and MAP30 SDS-PAGE SDS-PAGE was performed according to Laemmli. a total of 3 104 cells/mL were applied into 96-well microtiter plates at 100 L per well and exposed to PEGylated -MMC, PEGylated MAP30, and un-PEGylated counterparts. each concentration was tested in quadruplicate. the optical density (OD) at 570 nm was measured using an ELISA plate reader. cell viability and proliferation were observed together with controls. the inhibitory effect of PEGylated RIPs on herpes simplex virus-1 VERO cells were cultured to logarithmic growth phase. 105 VERO cells/mL was applied to 96-well microtiter plates at 100 L per well. exposed to un-PEGylated proteins at 3.3 mol L13.3 nmol L1 (100 mg L10.1 mg L1) and acyclovir (ACV) at 10 mol L10.01 mol L1 for 48 hours. each concentration was tested in quadruplicate. the percentage of inhibition was calculated by the formula described under the heading "Measurement of cytotoxicity" Sprague Dawley rats were randomly classified into control, -MMC, PEGylated -MMC, MAP30, and PEGylated MAP30 groups of ten each. the reactions were allowed to develop at 37°C for 15 minutes. tetramethyl benzidine (Sigma-Aldrich) was added as a substrate for horseradish peroxidase. purification of -MMC and MAP30 All steps tried either alone or in combination within the process of purification were carried out at 4–6°C unless specifically stated. -MMC and MAP30 SDS-PAGE SDS-PAGE SDS-PAGE were performed according to Laemmli. Western blotting analysis Briefly, -MMC was separated on SDS-PAGE and then transferred to an NC membrane. nonspecific binding was blocked and washed by placing the membrane in a solution of BSA. a total of 3 104 cells/mL were applied into 96-well microtiter plates at 100 L per well and exposed to PEGylated -MMC, PEGylated MAP30, and un-PEGylated counterparts. each concentration was tested in quadruplicate. at 570 nm was measured using an ELISA plate reader (EL 800, BIO-TEK, Atlanta, GA) cell viability and proliferation were observed together with controls. the inhibitory effect of PEGylated RIPs on herpes simplex virus-1 VERO cells was observed. microtiter plates were exposed to un-PEGylated proteins and PEGylated-proteins at 3.3 mol L13.3 nmol L1 (100 mg L10.1 mg L1) and acyclovir (ACV) at 10 mol L10.01 mol L1 for 48 hours. each concentration was tested in quadruplicate. 100 L of infected supernatant, which was 101 to 1010 diluted with medium, was added to each well. 100 L of infected supernatant, which was 101 to 1010 diluted with medium, was added to each well. VERO cells/mL were seeded into 24-well plates at 1 mL/well. then incubated with 5% CO2 at 37°C for 24 hours. 100 L of culture medium containing proteins was added to each well. negative and positive cell control established. 96-well plates were coated with 100 L of 30 g/mL purified antigen (RIPs and PEG-RIPs) in 0.05 M carbonate-coating buffer, pH 9.6, and incubated at 4°C. after washing, 300 L of PBS containing 3% BSA, pH 7.4, was added to each well. both -MMC and MAP30 were assessed by SDS-PAGE and Western blotting. the theoretical pI of -MMC is 9.32 and MAP30 is 8.86. JAR cells were seeded on 96-well plates and were treated with increasing concentrations of PEGylated RIPs and un-PEGylated counterparts for 72 hours. the concentrations of 1.5, 0.3, and 0.06 mg/mL started to significantly reduce the proliferation of cells after 48 and 72 hours of incubation. -MMC-treated groups showed fewer cells and abnormal shapes. MAP30 and PEGylated MAP30 also showed a similar cytotoxic effect to JAR cells. dose range of tested proteins inhibiting VERO cell infection with virus was below 3.3 mol L1.
